body:
Comment 4 by **Kevapo**: 
Just to be sure, this in addition to :
"An application - Go code that will be compiled into an executable command - always
defines package main with a main() function."

Those 2 restriction make it impossible to have a single package with the main() methods
and tests.
So i'm will never be able to
- to test a main package,
- to name the launcher/command line package something else than main 
and if I want to test part of a simple executable, I still have to have 2 different
package : a dummy main and the code inside another one that I want to test.
